intro: Psychotria involucrata, commonly known as the sacred plant of the Yucatec Maya, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and small, white or pale pink flowers. It is often found growing in humid, shaded environments such as tropical forests. Psychotria involucrata is also known for its psychoactive properties, making it significant in traditional spiritual and ceremonial practices.
